body.p: What happens to a postsynaptic cell membrane if chloride channels open as a result of neurotransmitter binding?

feedback.p: Correct. Chloride ions will diffuse into the cell and since they are negatively charged it will hyperpolarize the membrane causing an IPSP.
Incorrect. EPSP will occur when positive ions, such as sodium, moves into the cell making it less negative.
Incorrect. Depolarizing is the result of an EPSP when positive ions, such as sodium, moves into the cell making it less negative.

Incorrect. Although the change in charge (more negative on inside of membrane) is the same, repolarization is the phase of returning to resting membrane after a depolarization not the result of a neurotransmitter binding to postsynaptic membrane.

hint.p: Negatively charged chloride ions are more concentrated outside the cell membrane and will follow their concentration gradient to diffuse across an open membrane channel.

body.p: What type of summation achieves an action potential in a neuron resulting from simultaneous input of multiple other neurons?

feedback.p: Correct. the input from Multiple neurons at different locations on the postsynaptic neuron with receptors can add up to cause an action potential.
Incorrect. Even though this involves multiple stimulating neurons, this is not a physiological type of summation.
Incorrect. Even though this is happening between the axon terminal and its target, this is not a physiological type of summation.
Incorrect. Here the “adding” is being done over time at a single synapse, rather than from multiple neurons at one time.

hint.p: One type of summation depends upon the location or “spacing” of several stimulating neurons at multiple synapses and the other depends on the “timing” of stimulation at a single synapse.
